env.name: BEAKER_debug
env.description: Output verbose logging to troubleshoot tests. Set to false for more readable output of results.

env.name: BEAKER_destroy
env.description: When should the test boxes be destroyed. Onpass allows boxes to stay around when tests fail for further troubleshooting

env.name: BEAKER_keyfile
env.description: The ssh keyfile for access to the machines for testing.

env.name: BEAKER_PE_DIR
env.description: url where you can download the version of Puppet Enterprise you would like to test against. For public users this might look more like 'https://pm.puppet.com/cgi-bin/download.cgi?dist=ubuntu&rel=16.04&arch=amd64&ver=latest'

env.name: BEAKER_PE_VER
env.description: Puppet Enterprise version you would like to test against.

env.name: BEAKER_PUPPET_AGENT_VERSION
env.description: The version of the agent you would like to install on agent nodes for testing.

env.name: BEAKER_setfile
env.description: The location of the hosts file you would like to test against. This setting assumes you have a hosts.yaml file in the current directory from which you are invoking tests. Most likely this will be the top level of the module repo.

env.name: BEAKER_TESTMODE
env.description: This mode runs tests on the local machine. This will most likely be overridden by the agent, or master agent, mode values.

env.name: BEAKER_provision
env.description: Tell beaker whether you need to create the boxes on this run, or if they are already created and you can reach them.

env.name: TEST_FRAMEWORK
env.description: Test framework for use. The other valid value is simply beaker.

env.name: PUPPET_INSTALL_TYPE
env.description: Type of puppet install, Puppet enterprise master, or agents on nodes only. If testing a master agent scenario override this default to 'pe'.
